page.title: 05KING EDWARD'S SCHOOL,WITLEY
page.content: { King Edward's School}was founded in London in 1553 for the benefit of orphan boys.It transferred to Wormley in 1865 when land became available and is now a co-educational private school which accepts both boarding and day pupils from 11 to 18 years. {Buildings The oldest buildings are the main block and chapel,which were built in 1865.The newest building is the swimming pool which is still being built.The music school was built in 1963,boarding houses were built in 1976 and the gymnasium was built in 1887. {Staff There are 46 full time members of staff,28 part time members of staff and 94 non teaching staff,which include medical staff,librarians, ground staff and caterers.
